dataList.content: La verità dietro alla quantità assurda di Tassa Temporale che ci era addebitata era molto più semplice di quello che pensassi.

dataList.title: T Corp.
dataList.content: Circa una settimana fa, un fenomeno di perdita temporale non autorizzata è stato osservato al maniero di 'Wuthering Heights'... che vi ha portati molto più in alto nella fascia fiscale per l'uso di Tempo continuato a causa dell'enorme quantità di tempo fuoriuscito.
Un fenomeno di perdita temporale?

dataList.title: T Corp.
dataList.content: Si riferisce ad una decelerazione del flusso temporale in una determinata zona fisica. Nel vostro caso, non era neppure un'area decelerata statica... si è spostata per tutto il maniero a lungo, addirittura. Abbiamo misurato circa quattro ore totali di tempo mentre accadeva.
... Di che dannazione starebbe parlando?
Una decelerazione del flusso temporale in unna certa... Ah.
Deve riferirsi al momento in cui Dante ci ha donato la celerità quando stavamo inseguendo quell'uomo al maniero.
Impossibile. L'abilità del Manager si è attivata per meno di trenta minuti. È più probabile che la vostra misurazione di quattro ore sia un'errore di calcolo.
Ah, no. Data la strana sensazione che abbiamo provato lasciando il maniero... è molto probabile che non si siano verificati errori nei loro calcoli.
Ti ricordi, Dante? Quando stavamo lasciando il maniero...
Qualche giorno fa...
Aha! Meursault, avete scovato alcunché di strano nella vostra rou-tine mattutina?
Eravamo appena saliti su Mephistopheles dopo l'incidente al maniero di Wuthering Heights.
La maggior parte dei Peccatori si erano seduti in disparte, dato il nuovo volto addolorato di Heathcliff. Allo stesso modo... la voce allegra di Don Quixote, come sempre, aveva rotto il silenzio.
Ho identificato un'anomalia.
Avremmo dovuto ricevere il quotidiano della mattina, non quello della sera. Tuttociò è inconsistente con quanto tempo abbiamo impiegato nella visita al maniero.
Hm? Che non sia un mero sbaglio?

Da quando sono diventato un passeggero di questo autobus, i quotidiani mattutini mi sono stati consegnati durante le ore della mattina designate, e i quotidiani serali sono sempre stati consegnati nelle ore della sera designate.
La possibilità che abbiano commesso uno sbaglio non può essere esclusa. Ma la possibilità che si sia verificato è minuscola.
Oh, adesso che faccio più attenzione ... quello è un tramonto, non un'alba. Non me n'ero accorta per colpa dell'assenza di colori.
Non può essere! Queste dovrebbero essere la prime ore del dì, indubbiamente...?!
Ah, potrei avere un'idea di come si possa essere verificata questa inconsistenza.
... Giusto. Il Protocollo TT4.
<... Cosa sarebbe?>
Dispositivo di Sincronizzazione della Velocità Temporale... o qualcosa del genere.
L'ho visto in una pubblicità. "Una soluzione di lusso alle vostre necessità di sincronizzazione temporale. Passate le stesse piacevoli ore insieme."... o una roba simile.
Ooho...? Non è da voi, Ser Heathcliff, usare cotante difficoltose parole in una sola frase! Vi prego, qualched'uno potrebbe spiegarlo con parole più semplici?
... Haaaaaah...
È un'apparato che equipara la velocità del tempo di ogni induviduo sotto l'influenza del Dis... Protocollo TT4.
Aha...! Certamente, avevo trovato difatti bizzaro come qualcuno così abbiente di tempo potesse moversi e parlare alla stessa velocità di noialtri!
Hm. Quindi considerando questa informazioni, la conclusione è che il passaggio del tempo che abbiamo sperimentato nel maniero fosse più veloce rispetto al mondo esterno.
Questa è la spiegazione più coerente di come sia stato consegnato il quotidiano serale, invece che mattutino.
Bene. Ora che siete soddisfatti della spiegazione, non avrete problemi ad affrontare una nuova missione, giusto?
La LCA ci ha richiesto di rintracciare una Distorsione. Riguardo ai dettagli—
<... So activating my ability within the TT4 Protocol caused...>

Mm... Yes, indeed. It was akin to tampering with an already-accelerated flow of time; from an outsider's point of view, it would have appeared as though more time than what was actually spent was 'leaked'.

dataList.title: T Corp.
dataList.content: This bloke knows what he's talking about. Also, you didn't just manipulate time on a personal scale. Like I said earlier, you affected the flow of time within a physical space.

dataList.title: T Corp.
dataList.content: Let me remind you that it wasn't even a static field. It moved all over that manor. Honestly, this situation is completely unprecedented.
Right... They used to activate it only on special occasions like when we had plenty of guests over for a visit... because it was so bloody pricey.

dataList.title: T Corp.
dataList.content: So... the Time Tax for your inflated tax bracket, multiplied by the surtax-per-volume from the physical space covered by that temporal manipulation... yeah, no wonder it all adds up to this insane number.
It's ain't like we knew something like this would happen...

dataList.title: T Corp.
dataList.content: Well, anyway. You have two payment options to settle this Time Tax debt.
Oi, options? What options...? It ain't like bags of ten billion Ahn grow from a tree, innit?

dataList.title: T Corp.
dataList.content: Option one: cash payment. Option two: time payment.
Yeah, about that. What's that supposed to mean, anyway? "Paying with time"?

dataList.title: T Corp.
dataList.content: It means... oh.
The employee, who was about to answer our questions with painfully observable annoyance, suddenly jolted at the sound of an alarm.

dataList.title: T Corp.
dataList.content: ... Understood.

dataList.title: T Corp.
dataList.content: I just got a call that they're ready to hold the emergency meeting regarding this incident. Limbus Company may send two individuals to the meeting to represent your company.
No need to tick-tock and fuss, Dante. Dealing with complicated matters like this meeting is one of my responsibilities.
I will be joining them to discuss the possible solutions to this incident, so please keep the Sinners under control. Except you, Miss Faust. You're with me.
Understood.
Make another mess while I'm gone, and...
... only Ryōshū will enjoy what comes next. Keep that in mind as you wait.
Oho...
Well, off they go, I guess...? Didn't even give us the chance to ask them more questions.
They're just leaving us here like this...? But isn't this whole mess basically about what'll happen to us?
So... this isn't anything serious, but...
What's Meursault doing on the gallows?
<What?>
<Meursault, what are you doing up there?!>
I was told to stand here, so I have done so.
Who told you to do... that?

dataList.title: T Corp.
dataList.content: I did, I did! Just trying to be helpful with you and your friends' little Time Tax problem.
<I thought all employees were supposed to be at the emergency meeting?>

dataList.title: T Corp.
dataList.content: Woah, a clock with legs! How fascinating. If someone were to submit you for consideration at the upcoming expo, you might even be worth a participation trophy!

dataList.title: T Corp.
dataList.content: You remind me of the time when some hapless soul submitted a timepiece that doubled as a compass that had a rather tragic and critical design flaw: you could tell the time or find your path, but never both at once! Tell directions, or tell time? It was only one thing or the other, leaving you lost in time and stranded in the streets! That was no good, not at all. That's no better than a clock taped to a compass at the end of the day, is it?
Uhm...

dataList.title: T Corp.
dataList.content: Oh, right! TT5-2 Protocol is operating at an experimental capacity within this office space, so don't you forget! Anyone not synced with the Daily Standard Time might find this a little disorienting, so keep that in mind as well.
Whu-what...?

dataList.title: T Corp.
dataList.content: Now that's a look of someone who has never once heard of the TT5-2 Protocol, eh? TT5-2 Protocol, as its name suggests, is an invention to address the temporal efficiency problem present in the TT4 Protocol. It's doing test-runs in only a few select T Corp. offices, so if you do ever feel the urge to leave your impressions of this new shiny thing, feel free to jot down a few words on that bulletin— wait a minute, who wrote that 3-star review?
The man, whom we presumed to be a T Corp. Staff, seemed very adept at holding a one-sided conversation with zero external input.
Not that any of us could keep up with how fast he was speaking, anyway.

dataList.title: T Corp.
dataList.content: Anyways, if you're ready... let's get crackin'!
I am ready.
<Wait, I don't know if it's really a good idea to be ready for something that looks like—>
The rope extending from the intimidating machine tightened around Meursault's throat.
I… is this what it means to pay our Time Tax with time? Getting hanged from the gallows…?

dataList.title: T Corp.
dataList.content: Please call it by its precise and given name: Temporal Scale Gallows. It measures the exact amount of time you owe, and sucks that time right out of you. That wasn't the original name, mind you; there was simply too much hubbub and hullabaloo about its 'excessively long name', which was at approximately fifty-eight words. Or letters.
<… Can someone ask him what'll happen to Meursault?>
… Is that thing going to kill Meursault?!

dataList.title: T Corp.
dataList.content: Kill him? Nonsense! She's a very gentle machine! That is simply preposterous. However...
A 'however', spoken in such manner... oft portends that events of even greater ill-fortune shall befall us...

dataList.title: T Corp.
dataList.content: ... I'm not so sure as to what might happen, actually. I suppose it'll suck ten billion Ahn's worth of time out of your friend?
Stop being obtuse. What is that even supposed to mean?
... Is he going to be stuck like that for ten billion hours or something...?
Whuh?!

dataList.title: T Corp.
dataList.content: Well, not exactly. Let me tell you about T Corp.'s particularly generous system called the four-hour daily minimum time guarantee policy! How generous, hm? Even when worst comes to worst comes to worst, every citizen is entitled to the right to enjoy a minimum of four-hour days. According to the T Corp. Public Welfare Council, four hours is the absolute minimum number of hours in a day to guarantee human survival. 'Survive' being the key word here.

dataList.title: T Corp.
dataList.content: My, my, my! Sucking ten billion and forty million Ahn's worth of time from your friend was too much, I suppose. Look, it says “measurement error”. That rarely ever happens.
... Wait, you pulled the lever when you didn't even know what was going to happen? Just out of curiosity?

dataList.title: T Corp.
dataList.content: Hm? Of course! Ten billion Ahn of Time Tax debt is a historically unprecedented amount of debt, so I had to see what would happen. You could land first place in a lottery and you still wouldn't even come close to making ten billion Ahn, and that's before taxes. I'd say you all belong in a museum of history, if I'm being honest!

dataList.title: T Corp.
dataList.content:
Besides, I haven't seen anyone with more than 150 hours in Time Tax debt willingly step up the gallows before. Anyone beyond that usually chooses to run and digs themselves into an even deeper debt hole.
The point is, I scarcely expected someone in a ten billion Ahn Time Tax hole to just walk up there like that!
<What is wrong with this guy?>
Awaken, Meursault! Prithee, surrender not to such machinery!
Hoaugh?! T-thou art unharmed?
Mm. I am all right.
Why uh, why don't ya get down from the gallows for now, Meursault?
Vergilius and Faust, who returned just as this incident occurred, were both glaring at us with expressions that were anything but friendly...
